responses: Hello, this is NHT chatbot. How can I help you?

Any Symptoms?

Tell me your bp! Ex: 120-80
You have normal blood pressure. Please stick with the healthy diet.
You have Hypertension-Stage I. Your bp is elevated. Eat healthy food, decrease the salt in your diet and exercise regularly.
Hypertension-Stage I
You have Hypertension-Stage II. A combination of healthy lifestyle and BP-lowering medication is the recommended care plan for the patient.
Hypertension-Stage II
You can call me Nht.

patterns: can you recommend me any measures?
is there anything that i can do
responses: Mainly management of hypertension is possible by two ways: Life style modification or Pharmacological therapy
Weight Reduction, DASH Diet, Dietary sodium reduction, reduce alcohol, exercise, stress management
Do you want some food recommendations?

Skim or 1% milk, yogurt, Greek yogurt (calcium-rich foods can lower blood pressure), Lean meat, Skinless turkey and chicken, Low-salt, ready-to-eat cereals, Cooked hot cereal (not instant), Low-fat and low-salt cheeses, Fruits (fresh, frozen, or canned without added salt), Vegetables (fresh, frozen or canned, no added salt), Richly colored green, orange, and red items are high in potassium and minerals that help lower blood pressure, The goal is 5-9 servings of fruits and vegetables per day, Plain rice, pasta, and potatoes, Breads (English muffins, bagels, rolls, and tortillas), Lower salt prepared convenience food.

patterns: What are the foods that I should avoid?
responses: Butter and margarine, Regular salad dressings, Fatty meat, Whole milk dairy products, Fried foods, Salted snacks, Canned soups, Fast foods, Deli meats
Anti-hypertensive drugs like chlorothiazide, furosemide, Atenolol, propanolol, Prazosin, etc
Welcome! Remember me for future assistance.
